image-upscale.name: Image Upscale
image-upscale.title: Free In-browser Image Upscaler

image.alt: An image of a lake, forest, mountains and blue sky splitted out in half into low quality (before) and high quality (after) parts

image-upscale.description: Make your images bigger without a loss of quality.
image-upscale.content:
## Explanation
This upscaler runs entirely in your browser — no uploads, no servers, no hidden processing elsewhere. When you choose an image, everything happens locally on your device using modern web technologies.

Behind the scenes, the tool uses [UpscalerJS](https://upscalerjs.com/) , an open-source library built on [TensorFlow.js](https://www.tensorflow.org/js), to perform real AI upscaling. It runs a model called [GANS](https://upscalerjs.com/models/available/upscaling/esrgan-legacy/), a performative neural network trained to restore lost detail and enhance textures. This is one of the model of ESRGAN family, that stands for Enhanced Super-Resolution Generative Adversarial Network — the same family of models used in many professional image enhancement tools.

To keep your browser smooth while the AI works, the heavy processing is done inside a Web Worker. That means the upscaling happens in a separate background thread, so the main page stays responsive and interactive.

Because the entire process runs locally, your images never leave your computer. The AI model is downloaded once and runs right inside your browser’s GPU or CPU using [WebGL](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WebGL) acceleration, depending on your device.

text-replace.name: Text Replace
text-replace.title: Free In-browser Text Replacement Tool

image.alt: Long black text on a white background where words `Replace Text` in the center is highlighted with a blue rectangle

text-replace.description: Replace substring, symbol or whitespace occurrences in your text.
text-replace.content:
## Explanation
This text replacer runs entirely in your browser — no servers, no network requests, and no data ever leaves your device. Every replacement and transformation happens locally, instantly, and securely in your browser’s memory.

At its core, this tool performs direct text substitution using modern JavaScript regular expressions (RegExp). When you click **"Replace"**, it scans the entire input text and replaces all occurrences of your **"Find"** pattern with the chosen **"Replace"** text.

You can also work with invisible whitespace symbols. For example, if you select "New line" or "Tab" from the dropdown, the tool will insert the visible escape code like `\n` or `\t`. If you want to replace the visible escape code rather than actual characters, you need to add `\` before the text, like that `\\n` or `\\t`.

Everything happens in real time inside your browser. No external libraries or network calls are used — it’s pure client-side logic built for reliability and transparency.

Because the processing is entirely local, you can safely use this tool with sensitive or private text. Nothing is uploaded, stored, or logged. What you type stays exactly where it belongs: in your browser.
